etymologies: mid 17th century: so named because of the humming sound produced by the rapid vibration of the bird's wings

definitions: a small nectar-feeding tropical American bird that is able to hover and fly backward, typically having colorful iridescent plumage.

notes.text: Family Trochilidae: many genera and numerous species, including the ruby-throated hummingbird (Archilochus colubris) of the eastern US, and the red-crowned Anna's hummingbird (Calypte anna), found chiefly along the Pacific coast of the US

shortDefinitions: small nectar-feeding tropical American bird that is able to hover and fly backwards
